    &sup3;   INFO:  |                                                       |
&Auml;&uacute;&Auml;&Auml;&sup3;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Aacute;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;=&Auml;&Auml;&uacute;&Auml;
    &sup3;
    &sup3;   First full length album by this Seattle hardcore band.
    &sup3;   Here's are some nice lines I picked up from some website:
    &sup3;
    &sup3;   "When The Fartz broke up Blaine joined THE ACCUSED another
    &sup3;   Washington state punk band who played rather generic punk,
    &sup3;   although tunes like "Reagan's War Puppets" were nice and
    &sup3;   snotty. With Blaine on board THE ACCUSED mutated into a much
    &sup3;   heavier, much sicker, much rawer band. The vocalist Blaine
    &sup3;   replaced, John Dahlin, calls it metal. Whatever.They adop-
    &sup3;   ted a mascot named Martha Splatterhead and began their reign
    &sup3;   of terror. My first exposure to the band was in about 1984-
    &sup3;   85. I was writing for a zine in Canada called Norhthern
    &sup3;   Metal that reviewed THE ACCUSED's first LP "The Return Of
    &sup3;   Martha Splatterhead" on Subcore Records giving it a 0.0
    &sup3;   rating and absolutely crucifying it in the review. It is the
    &sup3;   only 0.0 review I remember ever seeing in Northern Metal.
    &sup3;   They hated it so much I knew I had to buy it. As I
    &sup3;   suspected, the album was a masterpiece of hardcore
    &sup3;   hysteria."
    &sup3;
    &sup3;   The European pressing was a co-release between Earache and
    &sup3;   Children of the Revolution (COR - what's in a name... :p)
    &sup3;
&Auml;&uacute;&Auml;&Auml;&Aacute;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;&Auml;=&Auml;&Auml;&uacute;&Auml;
